@jalada /etc/hosts entries don't have anything to do with what port you can connect on. It just maps names to IPs (or other names).
@rfunduk Except I said /etc/resolver. And if you look in the dev file Pow creates in there you will see a 'Port' line.
I'll just try my suggestion tonight and report here, so we can put an end to the confusion.

@jalada That would be the port of the DNS server to use in order to resolve the hostnames (as in, the port of the pow node app). Nothing to do with the hostname you eventually type into the address bar. The problem my suggestion is supposed to solve is the one where being offline makes it not work. So, in theory, what's happening is that OSX is for some reason _not_ trying the special, custom DNS server in order to resolve the .dev domains. Why? Who knows. So it was just worth a try to see if explicitly telling OSX that this hostname is local would cause it to skip it's usual DNS lookups (and hopefully _not_ skip the custom pow one).
So (oddly, considering the conversation here) when I disconnected from the network and tried to access my *.dev domains setup via pow -- wait for it -- everything worked fine. * shrug *
